data.title: Books of Interest
data.text:
Adamson, Peter. 2022. Byzantine and Renaissance Philosophy: A History of Philosophy Without Any Gaps. Vol. 6. Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Agamben, Giorgio. 2022. When the House Burns Down: From the Dialect of Thought. Trans. Kevin Attell. Salt Lake City, UT: Seagull Books.

Alpert, Avram. 2022. The Good-Enough Life. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Arcenas, Claire Rydell. 2022. America's Philosopher: John Locke in American Intellectual Life. Chicago: University of Chicago Press.

Bambach, Charles. 2022. Of an Alien Homecoming: Reading Heidegger's "Hölderlin." Albany: State University of New York Press.

Barash, Jeffrey Andrew. 2022. Shadows of Being: Encounters with Heidegger in Political Theory and Historical Reflection. Hannover: ibidem Press.

Baumeister, David. 2022. Kant on the Human Animal: Anthropology, Ethics, Race. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press.

Benezra, Karen, ed. 2022. Accumulation and Subjectivity: Rethinking Marx in Latin America. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Benso, Silvia. 2022. Rethinking Life: Italian Philosophy in Precarious Times. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Bialecki, Jon. 2022. Machines for Making Gods: Mormonism, Transhumanism, and Worlds without End. New York: Fordham University Press.

Brah, Avtar. 2022. Decolonial Imaginings: Intersectional Conversations and Contestations. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.

Bredlau, Susan, and Talia Welsh, eds. 2022. Normality, Abnormality, and Pathology in Merleau-Ponty. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Bruya, Brian. 2022. Ziran: The Philosophy of Spontaneous Self-Causation. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Cavell, Stanley. 2022. Here and There: Sites of Philosophy. Ed. Nancy Bauer, Alice Crary, and Sandra Laugier. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.

Chantre, Benoît. 2022. The Time Has Grown Short: René Girard, or the Last Law. Trans. Trevor Cribben Merrill. East Lansing: Michigan State University Press.

Chicka, Benjamin J. 2022. God the Created: Pragmatic Constructive Realism in Philosophy and Theology. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Cixous, Hélène. 2022. Osnabrück Station to Jerusalem. Trans. Peggy Kamuf. New York: Fordham University Press.

Connolly, William E. 2022. Resounding Events: Adventures of an Academic from the Working Class. New York: Fordham University Press.

Corjescu, Dan. 2022. The Global Ape: Between Extinction and Transcendence. Hannover: ibidem Press.

Coyle, Justin Shaun. 2022. The Beauty of the Trinity: A Reading of the Summa Halensis. New York: Fordham University Press.

Crick, Nathan, ed. 2022. The Rhetoric of Fascism. Tuscaloosa: University of Alabama Press.

Daniels, Megan J., ed. 2022. Homo Migrans: Modeling Mobility and Migration in Human History. Albany: State University of New York Press.

d'Eaubonne, Françoise. 2022. Feminism or Death: How the Women's Movement Can Save the Planet. Ed. and trans. Ruth Hottell. New York: Verso Books.

Decker, Jessica Elbert. 2022. Otherwise Than the Binary: New Feminist Readings in Ancient Philosophy and Culture. Albany: State University of New York Press.

DeRoo, Neal. 2022. The Political Logic of Experience: Expression in Phenomenology. New York: Fordham University Press.

Derrida, Jacques. 2022. Perjury and Pardon. Vol. 1. Ed. Ginette Michaud and Nicholas Cotton. Trans. David Wills. Chicago: University of Chicago Press.

Dreon, Roberta. 2022. Human Landscapes: Contributions to a Pragmatist Anthropology. Albany: State University of New York Press.

Drucker, Johanna. 2022. Inventing the Alphabet: The Origins of Letters from Antiquity to the Present. Chicago: University of Chicago Press.

duBois, Page. 2022. Democratic Swarms: Ancient Comedy and the Politics of the People. Chicago: University of Chicago Press.

Eagleton, Terry. 2022. Critical Revolutionaries: Five Critics Who Changed the Way We Read. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press.

Edelman, Shimon. 2022. Life, Death, and Other Inconvenient Truths: A Realist's View of the Human Condition. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.

Eggemeier, Matthew, Peter Joseph Fritz, and Karen V. Guth, eds. 2022. Religion, Protest, and Social Upheaval. New York: Fordham University Press.

Elkin, Rosetta S. 2022. Plant Life: The Entangled Politics of Afforestation. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press.

Elmore, Rick, and Ege Selin Islekel, eds. 2022. The Biopolitics...
